TalkBeer - Craft beer news, info, and discussion.
Home Forums > Beer Trading > Beer-It-Forward >

Hints & Hauls: Sour, Saison, and Funk Round 14!

Discussion in 'Beer-It-Forward' started by The Ryan, Mar 22, 2018.

Page 1 of 57
1 ← 2 3 4 5 6 → 57 Next >

  1. The Ryan

    Joined:
    Oct 24, 2013
    Location:
    Yes
    Post ID:
    1744579
    Date:
    2018-03-22 15:56
    https://media.giphy.com/media/l41Yn6Eygj3c8IsrC/giphy.gif

    Below is the Hints and Hauls thread for Sour, Saison, and Funk Round 14! Posting of hints for your sender and target are encouraged. Along with general shenanigans.

    The rules:

    A box filled with lambic, wild ales, berliners, saisons, farmhouse ales, goses, etc., as well as anything and everything else that has Brett or is otherwise rustic or funky.
    • A 12 bottle shipper maximum
    • All beers must be an rAvg of 4.0 or higher or a 'want' by your target.*
    • Try to find fun and exciting bottles/growlers that your target otherwise wouldn't likely be able to try
    • Quantity is good, quality is better!
    *If you can't hit wants, please try to find fun and exciting bottles / growlers that your target otherwise wouldn't likely be able to try. If, after you've hit the minimum within the guidelines, you want to add something that doesn't quite fit the 'rules' (homebrew or less than perfect rated, but still cool beer) go for it!
    • Shipping deadline: Monday, May 14th
    If you fail to ship by the deadline without a prior heads up, you will receive negative feedback.

    >
     
    Dear SARA's Cellar Members,

    Your first allotment of 2018 will be ready for pickup starting Saturday, April 7th, 2018 at our Capitola location only (not the Portal)!!! You'll be receiving four (4) bottles with this allotment, including Little Engine, a Saison that was fermented and aged entirely in stainless tanks with Pinot Noir lees from our local friends at Bargetto Winery (club only), Bridges Built, a Saison that spent several months in French oak barrels with peaches (club only), West Ashley, a barrel-aged Saison with apricots, and Bright Sea Blonde, a Belgian-style Blonde ale with lemon zest and grains of paradise.

    Don’t think they have barrels for those but maybe giant plastic barrels the Mexican cartels disposed of bodies in.

  413. brystmar

    Joined:

    Location:
    Seattle
    Post ID:
    1757187
    Date:
    2018-04-09 13:28
    My target's minimal involvement in this thread (plus a slow week at work recently) got me wondering what everyone's participation levels looked like. I've been playing around with Python lately, so let's put that to good use.

    Ladies, gentlemen, and homies... I present the inaugural SSF Participation Statistics:
    [google] https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/pub?key=10gjLoSp7k7S6CRoGXKj3NDx9Y_6FHcdeLift94oYJ8o&output=html&widget=true

    Since BIFs are primarily about communicating via gifs, I felt the gif contribution margin was the most important statistic here. For you non-business types: that's the % of a user's likes that came from posts containing a gif.

    Perhaps the most interesting finding was that Calcifer dished out 383 likes -- the 3rd most of anyone -- despite not being part of this BIF. A true gentleman.
    https://media.giphy.com/media/l4FGAIHUBgpxftTgs/giphy.gif

    Location:
    Yes
    Post ID:
    1757277
    Date:
    2018-04-09 15:02
    brystmar said:↑ >
    >
    My target's minimal involvement in this thread (plus a slow week at work recently) got me wondering what everyone's participation levels looked like. I've been playing around with Python lately, so let's put that to good use.
    >
    > Ladies, gentlemen, and homies... I present the inaugural SSF Participation Statistics:
    > [google] https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/pub?key=10gjLoSp7k7S6CRoGXKj3NDx9Y_6FHcdeLift94oYJ8o&output=html&widget=true >
    >
    > Since BIFs are primarily about communicating via gifs, I felt the gif contribution margin was the most important statistic here. For you non-business types: that's the % of a user's likes that came from posts containing a gif.
    >
    > Perhaps the most interesting finding was that Calcifer dished out 383 likes -- the 3rd most of anyone -- despite not being part of this BIF. A true gentleman.
    > https://media.giphy.com/media/l4FGAIHUBgpxftTgs/giphy.gif >
    >

    I've seen what happens when you nerds have edit control over a spreadsheet.
    https://media.giphy.com/media/7QOd9u8qQ4Hio/giphy.gif

    Mouse over a column header and click the down arrow to sort by that column. Only changes the view for you, not everyone.

    Also, updating all of the stats has potential to draw a ton of bandwidth, so I'm working with Gene to ensure this silly little experiment doesn't adversely impact the site. Might be awhile before I update the data again.
    >
     
    Updated everything again about an hour ago.

    Scraping the 'likes' data consumes more bandwidth than I anticipated. Moving forward, I'll be adding data about new posts on a daily basis but only updating the 'likes' data once or twice per week. When I do update the likes data, it'll only be for posts less than a week old. So if you want everyone else to see how slutty you are at dishing out likes, be sure to do it within a week.

    primebeer said:↑ >
    >
    https://i.imgur.com/OsgC3tT.jpg >
    >
    > I drank some old gueuze tonight. In order from left to right: ‘05 OGV, ‘04 OG, ‘02 OGV, ‘08 OG, morning ‘07 Bio, ‘05 label Iris, ‘07 St Valetijns OGV. Overall, stellar bottles with the ‘02 OGV and ‘05 Iris being the highlights. ‘02 OGV was complex as hell and smelled like a fine blue cheese. Cork popped off as the cage was undone. The ‘05 Iris 375 was literally everything that old Iris is supposed to be. I may wake up and this was all a dream, but for now I’m very happy with a good night of drinking.
    >

    > Sender: I've been too lazy to figure out who you are, but some of the hints in the last week or so make me suspect a few people.. as soon as I'm unburied from the work I missed last week I may make the effort to figure out who you are.
    >

    Target: At 1pm today, Holy Mountain announced a new beer for release at 3pm today (on a Tuesday!?):
    >
    ANARETA is a wheat based beer that went through primary fermentation with a house mixed culture in bourbon barrels, where it continued to age for over a year. This batch was then transferred into wet Cognac Puncheons on top of massive amounts of Blueberries, where it went through a secondary fermentation before bottling. Refermented in the bottle with Brettanomyces.
    >
     
    Like this post and you get a bottle. Otherwise I'm drinking mine and sending the other to a trading partner.

    Can I run a mini LIF within this BIF? I’m going to go with yes.

    I’ll be drinking some of that fine N.C. Terrior tomorrow and will grab a few bottles to send out while I’m there.

    Rules:
    1 Winner, must be a participant of this BIF.
    LIF will end tomorrow at 9:00pm EST.

    Guess a number between 1-40. I’ll use a random number generator tomorrow that will choose the winner.
    In the event that no one gets the exact number, we’ll choose the winner Price is Right style - closest number to not go over wins.

    https://i.imgur.com/ha4IH.gif

    https://i.imgur.com/GSHTQrG.gif

    Birds Fly South Brand New Eyes (this was pouring at Farmhouse Fest but I missed it - excited to get a second shot!)
    Side Project Saison du Fermier (YES. Been wanting some SP for ages)

  794. The Ryan

    Joined:
    Oct 24, 2013
    Location:
    Yes
    Post ID:
    1768045
    Date:
    2018-04-23 15:04
    Target: Two saisons were acquired for you.

    One started life as a marriage between a brett saison and a sour golden ale. It rested in some type of vessel for one year and sashayed onto apricots.

    The other was a basic bitch saison and spent time abroad in French Oak Pinot Noir barrels. Apricots were added too for some undetermined amount of time.

    Both breweries are south of me and not too far from one another. One is more well known than the other. But I like the newer one.

    Kissing cousins, perhaps?

    https://media.giphy.com/media/BAPmCE5mIf6FO/giphy.gif

    I took a ride out to CT on Friday and made my first trip to OEC. Picked up a bottle, maybe 2 for my target. Target, like this post if this is something you would be interested in. I know not everybody is into flanders sours and your info on the spreadsheet doesn't mention either way.

    https://i.imgur.com/2cHGncZ.jpg

    Description from the back label:
    Antioch Tokaji Double Barrel Singularis is a blend of our "flemish red" style ales matured from 6 months to 3 years in red wine barrels and then double matured for 3 months in a special Tokaji white wine barrel from the Royal Tokaji Winery in Hungary

    Morning, all! Let me just clarify some statements made on Page 41. When I said I was "down to" some BA Rev cans, shelfie Etre orders, and beers received in BIFs/LIFs...don't get me wrong, I'm still a mid-tier hoarder/alcohobbyist. I've got plenty of beer to drink myself. Those last 2 categories are HUGE. I got an awesome 12-shipper from Thevicster in MAW. Then the (yasqueen.gif) box from andrewdrinks arrived last Friday, the same day I met brystmar in person, who for some reason gave me beer (thanks again). Yesterday, I got another Etre box in:

    http://i.imgur.com/gFjO2QU.jpg

    And to top it all off, during Secret Santa, lazerviking ran a LIF to pass along and show how cool a 1-bottle shipper could be....well, then yesterday, this shows up too (!!! - I was told there would be no math)

    http://i.imgur.com/MjlXAhZ.jpg

    (LOL - look I didn't want anything even touching Family Whistle on either side)

    Thank you so much, guys - I'm close to speechless, as always. This site is the best. Thanks again!

    > Haw River - New brewery tick
    > Benchtop - New brewery tick
    >
    > Thank you so much for this lovely box of beer. I can't wait to get started on it, everything is going straight into the fridge!
    >
     
    Enjoy! I’m a big fan of that Benchtop Gose. If I hadn’t drank the other 7 I would have sent more.

  916. ExPimp

    Joined:
    Apr 12, 2013
    Location:
    On tha corna
    Post ID:
    1774940
    Date:
    2018-05-02 18:36
    leftoverburrito said:↑ >
    >
    Target: 20 minutes ago there was a package left on your porch. I know pimpin' ain't easy but get home.
    >
     

    https://media.giphy.com/media/urp8cVywl1Sk8/giphy.gif

    Wow, you guys in the PNW always fuck my shit up in BIFs...

    https://i.imgur.com/VNz3DAZ.jpg

    https://i.imgur.com/fFgv9GA.jpg

    https://i.imgur.com/oig8Hj0.jpg

    Commons - Urban Farmhouse (RIP Commons, never ticked this one!)
    De Garde - Grand Blanc (new tick and I <3 Blanc grape sours)
    Gigantic - Big Brett Love (new tick and the description sounds amazing)
    Upright - Fantasia (I'll never tire of this beer)
    De Garde - The Bluest (only had a small pour once, look forward to revisiting)
    De Garde - The Orchard (new tick and <3 DG stone fruit beers)
    De Garde - The Lucy (new tick and <3 grape sours)
    De Garde - The Broken Truck (finally ticking a Broken Truck!)
    3F - A&G (shamefully, I still haven't ticked this)
    Ale Apothecary - OJ Dan (have never had a special release from them, sounds fucking awesome though!)
    Block 15 - Ripple (wow, it's been 4yrs since I've ticked a Block 15 beer, what's wrong with me?! Description sounds quite tasty!)
    Block 15 - Turbulent consequence (more fruity sour goodness!)

    You guys absolutely destroyed me, I don't know what the fuck else to say! My friends that will be sharing this beer with me and I thank you tremendously!

  936. bathroomlaughter

    Joined:
    Oct 3, 2013
    Location:
    california
    Post ID:
    1776029
    Date:
    2018-05-03 20:16
    ah heck

    ah jeez

    i got a big ol box of beer

    http://blob:https://imgur.com/39571f5e-1988-497f-a93b-5990871a1b9e
    https://i.imgur.com/Fxi8Vy2.jpg

    casey east bank
    casey fruit stand cab franc
    jester king colour five
    jester king space waves
    jester king wanderflora
    jester king spon muscat
    boon gueuze vat 109
    black project elsewhere
    night shift bramblewise
    american solera raspbarrel
    collective brewing project dream folk
    the veil escape

    when i saw the box was from austin i was stoked. jester king has always been a big gap in my ticking oeuvre. i've never had a texas homie and never really had a homie who had a texas homie so i've only had a few JK bottles through my many years of sours. i'm stoked to finally fill that gap with these bangers. tons of kooky, unique beers in here which is exciting. 10 new ticks, 2 breweries i didn't even know about until now, and some of my favorite casey beers i'm very excited to revisit.

    thanks for the killer box jrstar96. i can't wait to dive in.

    target, i'm gonna prowl around this weekend and see what i can find to round out your box. i'll look to ship next week. i'm shipping to a land with no surf, just pine trees.

    IndianaJones you sly sunnofabitch! I wish I had BrandoSF's self-control..there was no edging for me, I made a big, big mess. Anyway, here goes...

    First, the Locals

    [imgur] https://s9e.github.io/iframe/imgur.min.html#F6mv1xD

    Live Oak Hefeweizen
    Saint Arnold Art Car IPA​

    I dipped into one of those Live Oak Hefes and it took me right back to Deutschland...

    Next, The Americans

    [imgur] https://s9e.github.io/iframe/imgur.min.html#Vz0sSIO

    (from l to r)

    JK - Aurelian Lure (Blend 5)
    JK - Spon Mourvedre & Sangiovese
    JK - Spon 2 - 3 Year Blend
    American Solera - Raspbarrel
    American Solera - Pom Foo
    Weldwerks - Peach Climacteric
    de Garde / Jackie O's - With Friends Like These
    HF - Elaborative 4
    HF - Flora​

    Not pictured - JK - Spon Raspberry & Cherry...unfortunately, didn't make the journey (RIP)​

    The Europeans

    [imgur] https://s9e.github.io/iframe/imgur.min.html#pJ6BzWY

    Cantillon - Vigneronne
    3F - Oude Geuze​

    And last, but not least, The Firewater

    [imgur] https://s9e.github.io/iframe/imgur.min.html#MLmsMvi

    Old Rip Van Winkle 10 yr
    Old Scout Rye 7 yr
    Yamazaki 18 yr (wat?!)​

    Seriously, IndianaJones you styled us! Thank you a million times! We've got lots of bottles to enjoy this Summer while we celebrate BrandoSF's newborn (any day now).

    Also, best of luck to your Rockets (but not too much luck). Looking forward to a great series!

  1016. The Ryan

    Amazing box from the lovely state of Colorado. Cronkite11 was my assigned sender. No surprise there, but the lovely curated box was shock and awe. Not had Black Project, that will change. An exceptional selection of lambic methode inspired colship beers on fruit and a few select Casey bottles. All of which will be enjoyed. Thank you!

    https://i.imgur.com/Z4y9SzR.png

    Black Project Thor
    Tagboard
    Cygnus

    https://i.imgur.com/t8SJ7L6.png

    Black Project Roswell
    Montauk
    Atlas

    https://i.imgur.com/417BNr5.png

    Black Project Mach Limit looks like Malbec/Merlot
    Mach Limit looks like Cab Sauv and Petit Verdot hnnnnngggg
    Cygnus other cherry blend woah

    https://i.imgur.com/BUqydio.png

    Some phenomenal sounding Casey.

    The Mix Peach Bank
    2 of Amerikaz Most Wanted
    Casey Family Preserve Plum (Santa Rosa)

    and...

    https://media.giphy.com/media/YQk8nXloVftzW/giphy.gif

    https://i.imgur.com/vOttrem.png?1

    Thank you very much.

    https://media.giphy.com/media/3otPoQqcUCNsTnaHDy/giphy.gif

  1027. IndianaJones

    Joined:
    Dec 3, 2015
    Location:
    The Lost Ark
    Post ID:
    1782337
    Date:
    2018-05-11 11:30
    IndianaJones said:↑ >
    >
    Received a truly awesome box from coldcrash tonight, will have the haul posted ASAP tomorrow! Thanks Shawn!
    >
     
    As promised, here's an account of the awesome haul from yesterday! Totally floored with this box

    https://i.imgur.com/7XdSH8B.jpg

    Ploughman Cider - Jules (I'm super stoked to try this after reading about the Scratch series!)
    Lindemans - GingerGueuze (new lambic tick!)
    HF/Blaugies - La Vermontoise
    Pizza Boy - Whatever, Forever
    OEC - Orenji (this one sounds interesting, collab with a Japanese brewer and a collection of different BA beers)

    https://i.imgur.com/RhutzLI.jpg

    SARA - Saison Bernice and Nonna's Blend #14 (despite loving SARA, I've actually never had Bernice. Glad to change that)
    Anchorage - Love Buzz
    Tomes - Boo! and Dalmatienne (always down to dig into Soy oddities)

    https://i.imgur.com/zecAcgF.jpg

    Right Proper - Ornithology (new brewery tick)
    Allagash - Belfius (sounds great, looking forward to some Portland, ME spontaneous blend)
    Burley Oak - Sorry Chicky (always enjoy a good dry-hopped sour)
    Manor Hill - Grisette (new brewery tick)
    Union Craft - Old Pro Gose (new brewery tick)

    Wow coldcrash, you knocked it out of the park with this box! Exactly what I was hoping for from SSF - a great blend of ticks from old favorite and new breweries alike. Can't wait to break into these later today! Thanks again Shawn!

  1043. coach

    Joined:
    Oct 1, 2013

    Oregon
    Post ID:

    2018-05-12 14:05
    jammery said:↑ >
    >
    Target: there’s still one slot left in the shipper. Should I fill it with cat treats?????
    >
    > https://i.imgur.com/vKLYlZs.gif >
    >
    > Or should i add more Hill Farmstead?
    >
     
    Both leftoverburrito and I have cats, but I think I speak for both of us in saying that Shaun Hill is easily the best brewer in the world. There's honestly no one else remotely in his class, in our estimation. These beers are so much better than anything else we've had, in their styles, and this is true across so many different types of beer. It's just unbelievable the degree to which we enjoy these beers more than other representations of the same style. We don't say this lightly either. It would be convenient if we didn't need to drive three thousand miles for our favorite beers, but that's just the reality of the situation.

  1051. Farnsworth

    Joined:
    Jul 7, 2014
    Location:
    Chicago, IL
    Post ID:
    1783227
    Date:
    2018-05-12 18:34
    THE PRON!
    jtmartino, DUDE, Was stoked to see find out you as my sender, but damn man... I could not have imagined it would be THIS good!

    https://www.volunteeringsolutions.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/excited.gif

    Let the gratuitous amount of exclamation marks comence!

    First half:
    https://i.imgur.com/JX1Fgbc.jpg

    • Lost Abbey Veritas Peach: Ooooo My. Veritas 16 was amazeballs, so super excited for this one!
    • Lost Abbey Amazing Grace: Wine barrel aged beer get me excited!
    • De Garde Foeder d'Or: I love rye in beers, and have yet to be let down by a De Garde beer!
    • Upright Fatali Four: Huuuuge fan of upright, and regular Four is a longtime favorite. This ones already in the fridge.
    • Good Beer Company Cobwebs: Have had just a few from GBC, but from what I've had im surprised they aren't talked about more. Super Excite!
    https://therobynbirdsnest.files.wordpress.com/2018/02/whose-line.gif

    Second Half:
    https://i.imgur.com/QdtBSBd.jpg
    http://seahawksdraftblog.com/wp-content/uploads/stunned-silence.gif
    Holy Moly Batman
    • SARA Much Appreciated
    • SARA Birdsong Platitudes
    • SARA Wundermutt - WUT, 3 SARA Cellar beers?! Haven't even heard of these, but Cellar beers blow me every time I try them. And the reviews on these seem like that is going to happen three more times!!
    • SARA Fruit Punch #3: My goodness... I mean... all the fruit... yas
    • SARA West Ashley: I think my pants just shrank.
    • SARA Nonna's Blend 14: This will be my first Nonna's blend, cant wait!!
    • SARA/Cycle Tandem: Another one that wasn't even on my radar but that sounds like a combination that can't go wrong!
    https://m.popkey.co/0338ec/rMyW_f-maxage-0_s-200x150.gif

    jtmartino
    https://media.tenor.com/images/74a474bd97af0e649c86230120194ef1/tenor.gif

    Really man, cant thank you enough! Multiple already in the fridge for tonight, a couple will be saved for a funkier DLD, and I cant see the rest lasting the month. Everything in this box sounds like a banger!

    Cheers!

    >
    THE PRON!

      • >

      • >

      • >

  1093. primebeer

    Joined:
    Feb 2, 2014
    Post ID:
    1785273
    Date:
    2018-05-15 16:08
    Ok. I’m calm. I think.

    First, the lambic. All of the lambic.
    https://i.imgur.com/51njHKn.jpg
    Iris ‘16- Yes! I’ve been working on getting together a bunch of Iris to age as I love this beer with a few years on it. This one is already two years old next week!
    Fou ‘17- Fresh Fou, my dear friend. This won’t last the month!
    A&G Magnum ‘17- Will be saved for a special occasion or an irresponsible solo dome in appropriate TB glassware.
    Vigneronne ‘16- good lord! Vig is and always be one of my favorite beers all time.
    Girardin Black Label- the golden standard. Recently had one blind at Grote and it’s always nice to ground yourself with this beauty of a beer.

    The rest of the bounty:
    https://i.imgur.com/0AzykaQ.jpg
    Cask Cherry- Not sure I’ve ever had this, and can’t wait to get into it soon!
    Florence- old faithful, literally cannot have enough of these
    Anna- see above. My gf will be very happy to see this as well. Will be sharing with her!
    Arthur- same as Anna, love this damn beer
    JK BdBdB- I’m a JK fanboi so I’m stoked to revisit this one, b4
    Vanderghinste Flanders Sour- not familiar with this but the convenient size will mean it will be consumed and enjoyed in short order.

    Holy hell. jermy, you’ve outdone yourself! Thanks so much for the insane box!!! I will remember this! My coworkers all think I’m crazy but there was no way I was waiting to open and document this box. Just insane.

    Thanks also to The Ryan for encouraging me to join this BIF, life got in the way and I wasn’t as active as I would have liked but I will definitely be joining this one again in the future!

    Denver
    Post ID:
    1785394
    Date:
    2018-05-15 19:59
    primebeer said:↑ >
    >
    Ok. I’m calm. I think.
    >
    > First, the lambic. All of the lambic.
    > https://i.imgur.com/51njHKn.jpg >
    > Iris ‘16- Yes! I’ve been working on getting together a bunch of Iris to age as I love this beer with a few years on it. This one is already two years old next week!
    > Fou ‘17- Fresh Fou, my dear friend. This won’t last the month!
    > A&G Magnum ‘17- Will be saved for a special occasion or an irresponsible solo dome in appropriate TB glassware.
    > Vigneronne ‘16- good lord! Vig is and always be one of my favorite beers all time.
    > Girardin Black Label- the golden standard. Recently had one blind at Grote and it’s always nice to ground yourself with this beauty of a beer.
    >
    > The rest of the bounty:
    > https://i.imgur.com/0AzykaQ.jpg >
    > Cask Cherry- Not sure I’ve ever had this, and can’t wait to get into it soon!
    > Florence- old faithful, literally cannot have enough of these
    > Anna- see above. My gf will be very happy to see this as well. Will be sharing with her!
    > Arthur- same as Anna, love this damn beer
    > JK BdBdB- I’m a JK fanboi so I’m stoked to revisit this one, b4
    > Vanderghinste Flanders Sour- not familiar with this but the convenient size will mean it will be consumed and enjoyed in short order.
    >
    > Holy hell. jermy, you’ve outdone yourself! Thanks so much for the insane box!!! I will remember this! My coworkers all think I’m crazy but there was no way I was waiting to open and document this box. Just insane.
    >
    > Thanks also to The Ryan for encouraging me to join this BIF, life got in the way and I wasn’t as active as I would have liked but I will definitely be joining this one again in the future!
    >
     
    https://media.giphy.com/media/VVVHfioinGnjG/giphy.gif

    Digging into some tasty SSF brews from coldcrash

    https://i.imgur.com/zRPF9lh.jpg

    https://i.imgur.com/T8IQfTr.jpg

    Can't say I've ever been in love with grisettes, but this one is definitely swaying that notion. Not sure if it's because it's oak fourdre aged or what, but it's a killer brew, especially as it warms. And of course, Allagash needs no additional fanfare - it's great as expected!

    Found a beautiful box of beer on my doorstep today, courtesy of SoCal badass bathroomlaughter (at least, I think). I mistakenly ruled out all Left Coast SSF'ers as senders, and I couldn't be happier to be wrong.

    This box is out of control, so let's get to the pron:
    https://i.imgur.com/k44CkVw.jpg
    https://i.imgur.com/du3cxlw.jpg

    MT Monster Tones maple bourbon BA pastry stout SOUR -- Glad I liked your post, super pumped about this! <3
    MT Glimmer Void -- The guy knows I like fruit sours
    MT Transit of Venus -- Hey look, more fruit
    MT/JK Shrine of the Forsaken Gods -- Pretty sure I got this in SSF13 too. Fruity as hell, so good.
    Monkish Bisous -- Omg fruits
    Monkish Same Tree -- MOAR FRUITS
    Nonna's Blend #13 -- Among my favorites from SARA
    Saison Bernice -- Was down to my last bottle, can't get enough!
    Toolbox Ruby -- Love me some Toolbox, especially new sour ticks
    Council Magic Factory Vienne -- This will be my first Magic Factory beer!
    HF CD19 -- Very excited for this! Been quite some time since I had a non-shelfie HF; wife is pumped too.
    HF Elaborative #4 -- Another HF?! Dude.

    https://media.giphy.com/media/a0Lgc1JvbfS4o/giphy.gif

    I'm floored. This is precisely what I love about these BIFs: getting stalked, being wrong about your sender, then admitting defeat at the hands of a generous mofo. Round of applause for you, bathroomlaughter. You crushed it!

  1130. jammery

    Date:
    2018-05-18 13:28
    In typical FedEx fashion, box 1 of 2 arrived from the dynamic duo of BrandoSF and DerGundhof. I figured I’d post this now because if the other box doesn’t show in the next hour or two, there’s a chance I won’t get to open it until Monday.

    https://i.imgur.com/Xf9dvvTh.jpg

    The sweet, swaggy contents are as follows:
    Toronado snapback - I’m actually in need of new hats that I can wear to shifts at the bar and brewery. This will do nicely
    SARA and Rare Barrel proper glassware - possibly a foreshadowing of things to come?
    Cellarmaker/Tired Hands collab - TacoHands Culinary IPA. No tacos were used in the making of this beer. Sadly.

    This box serves nicely as an appetizer and bodes well for the main course based on the generosity therein.

    More pron to come

    Much thanks and cheers!

    >
